The provided document discusses strategies for optimizing graphics performance, particularly focusing on managing fill rate consumption and efficiently handling transparency modes in Panda3D. The chunk emphasizes best practices for enabling transparency modes only when necessary, suggests using M_ binary mode for better performance without back-to-front sorting, and mentions that M_ dual may be more efficient than M_ alpha under certain conditions. It also refers to a detailed explanation of transparency modes for further information.

Do not enable transparency modes unless it is necessary, and when you do, consider using the M_binary mode, which does not require back-to-front sorting. However, if alpha blending is required and if large areas of the polygons are fully transparent, using M_dual may provide an improvement over M_alpha.

For a more in-depth explanation on the various transparency modes, see transparency-and-blending.
